result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with the co-defendant or with victim Georgia Z or the business listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination, at agent's discretion due to the young age of defendant's child. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court sentences the defendant to the following:

COUNT 1, 2 and 3

Any outstanding costs and fines and surcharges are to be converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Sarah J Bell in court with Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Ehrfurth makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   **CONCURRENT**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling-at agent's discretion (due to Defendant having 4 year old child)
____No contact with: Co-Defendant or with victim Georgia Z. or business listed in criminal complaint  

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  45 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling-at agent's discretion (due to Defendant having 4 year old child)
____No contact with: Co-Defendant or with victim Georgia Z. or business listed in criminal complaint  

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #3:   WITHHELD SENTENCE

Sentencing hearing at 11-30-2015 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sarah J Bell in court with Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1, and enters guilty plea to Counts #2 & 3 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1-3 on amended information.  Count #4 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Ehrfurth requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Sarah J Bell in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sarah J Bell in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Officer Nathan Smidt sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Hirt.  Cross examination by Attorney Ehrfurth.  Redirect by Attorney Hirt.  Recross by Attorney Ehrfurth.  City of Waukesha Detective Steve Guth sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Hirt.  Cross examination by Attorney Ehrfurth.   Closing statements.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Ehrfurth objects and moves for dismissal.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
